meanings.definition: To outdo in plotting or scheming.
meanings.sent1: She outplotted her friend in planning the surprise party.
meanings.sent2: The detective outplotted the criminal to solve the case.
meanings.sent3: The clever fox outplotted the sneaky rabbit in finding the hidden treasure.
meanings.sent4: The master spy outplotted his enemies with his intricate schemes.
meanings.sent5: In the game of chess, the grandmaster outplotted his opponent with strategic moves.

meanings.definition: To surpass in planning or devising.
meanings.sent1: He outplotted his classmates in coming up with a creative science project.
meanings.sent2: The architect outplotted the competition with his innovative building design.
meanings.sent3: The young inventor outplotted the older scientists with his groundbreaking invention.
meanings.sent4: Her elaborate plan outplotted all other strategies in the competition.
meanings.sent5: The team outplotted their rivals by thinking outside the box.
